website_summaries.verdict: Thanks to its compact physical size and bundled software, the WD My Passport Edge is a very good companion for mobile users.
pros: The WD My Passport Edge is compact, and offers fast USB 3.0 performance as well as useful software
cons: The My Passport Edge is comparatively more expensive than other drives of the same capacity

customer_reviews.title: It really is pretty slim.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both have the non "Edge" edition of this drive and the Edge is definitely way thinner. Performance-wise it seems to be on par with the other WD drives in its family. I'm using it personally to store VMs on for my macbook. So I'm running the VMs off the drive with Fusion and everything performs just fine in the regard. I picked it up because I believe it would perform well, but mostly because I wanted minimum bulk to carry around with my macbook and this definitely met both criteria.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Sprigler

C'mon WD - Been a customer since the 80's and now I had to find a magnifying glass just to reads the link to your 77-page manual(Yes, folks 77 pages and you better have a laser printer or backup color cartridges for your printer! )

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous and fast to boot!
customer_reviews.text: Western Digital must have a whole new crop of designers. All of WD's new products are beautiful and compact, worthy for the road warriors. This drive is so slim, about the thickness of my iPhone and barely larger than, well .. the iPhone. This drive's guarantee not to add any bulk to your brief case and hold 500GB of data. I don't have a USB 3.0 port to test it, but the USB 2.x compatible is pretty fast. I can copy a large file out of it (5GB) and watch a video (4.6GB) at the same time without hiccup. I have many WD hard drives and none was ever failed on me yet for the last 5 years.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Device!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device three weeks ago, I've been using and this is excellent, later install all the software include into the device, you have to pick the drive that you have to create a backup and let the device does his work, automatically. If the device is connected to the PC, he will check any change into the computer disk and he will make the same change into himself. If there are files that does not save in the moment, do not worry, he will save that files at the end. I'm very impressed. I recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very good...
customer_reviews.text: Well, so far this seems to be a very good product. I like the app that allows me to protect the drive by using a password. I can see that be very useful for me one day. I also started using the Backup feature. It managed to find files that I would not have thought about to back up. However though, it's a very slow process. I had to stop it, because I didn't have the time to back it all up, but the good thing is it will continue where I left off. So I definitely like this one, but Western Digital always seems to make good hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Boy

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital My Passport
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hard drive. It transfers fast, looks nice and sleek and works when it's supposed to. I haven't lost any files as of yet! One thing I like about this that I didn't about a previous hard drive was the cable connector. My older hard drive had a loose cable connector and that was a huge complaint in all the reviews. This one stays nice and snug when it's connected to the computer. I don't use the software...just drag and drop.
customer_reviews.author: Ms_Ladi

customer_reviews.title: Good but there are better options...
customer_reviews.text: This drive is good and useful. However, my first impression upon handling the drive was that it felt cheap. It is light and plastic and uninspiring. Most importantly it does work and work well. In my testing this drive writes at around 12.38mb/s and it reads at about 17.73mb/s. Meaning: it moves files and it does so quickly. Installation was non-existent. I plugged it in and it worked. Nice and easy. Having tested both, I would not choose this drive over the Seagate Slim 500 (). I found the WD drive to feel cheap and light, whereas the Seagate felt sturdy and substantial. At to that: the Seagate is smaller. The choice is clear.
customer_reviews.author: S. Templar

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MY PASSPORT EDGE PORTABLE HARD DRIVE – THE ULTRA-COMPACT, HIGH-CAPACITY TRAVEL COMPANION.
My Passport Edge offers high capacity in an ultra-compact portable drive. It features the blazing speed of USB 3.0 connectivity; automatic backup software; and password protection and hardware encryption to help keep your data private while you put it in your briefcase, backpack or purse and take it on the road. 

Ultra-compact design with high capacity.
Offering high capacity in an ultra-compact design, My Passport Edge is the ideal companion for road warriors traveling light but needing to take their digital content on the road. Automatic backup. 
WD's automatic, continuous backup software works quietly in the background to help protect your data using minimal PC resources. Whenever you add or change a file, it's instantly backed up.

Password protection secures your drive.
Use the WD Security utility to set password protection and hardware encryption and protect your files from unauthorized use or access.
Ultra-sleek design with high capacity - At just 12.8mm, this ultra-sleek drive is thin and fast with plenty of capacity for your important digital content.

*Performance may vary based on user's hardware and system configuration.

USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 compatibility - With this single drive you get compatibility with your USB 2.0 devices today and the ultra-fast speed of USB 3.0 when you're ready to step up to the to the next generation.

Automatic, continuous backup software - WD SmartWare automatic backup software works quietly in the background to help protect your data using minimal PC resources. Whenever you add or change a file, it's instantly backed up.

Durable enclosure protects the drive inside - We know your data is important to you. So we build the drive inside to our demanding requirements for durability, shock tolerance, and long-term reliability. Then, we protect the drive with a robust, all-metal enclosure designed for beauty.

WD Security - WD Security allows you to set password protection and hardware encryption for your drive to help protect your files from unauthorized use or access.

WD Drive Utilities - Register your drive, set drive timer, run diagnostics and more using WD Drive Utilities.

USB-powered - Powered directly from the USB port on your Mac. No separate power supply is needed.

Ideal for

 * Securing your files from unauthorized access with password protection and hardware encryption
 * Connecting and powering through your USB interface
